name: Humboldt Penguin
description: The Humboldt Penguin is a medium-sized penguin with black and white markings.
spread_note: Found along the Pacific coast of Peru and Chile.
food_note: Dives to hunt, often in small groups.
reproduction: Lays 1-2 eggs in a burrow or crevice, incubation about 40 days.
attractions: Popular in zoos for their playful swimming.
projects_note: Vulnerable due to overfishing and climate change; conservation is active.
breeding: Commonly bred in captivity for zoos.
